comment._content: Edmund Burke, opera singer. According to Bismarck daily tribune., March 02, 1916, Image 4 (with photo), he was an Irish baritone who was forming an Irish vounteer regiment in Canada. The sun., October 25, 1914, THIRD SECTION, Page 2 ("Edmund Burke, English Opera Singer, got Pictures of Battle in Marne Valley") reported that he was an English opera singer, formerly member of Canadian militia, who "sang and photographed his way in the wake of the French army". According to The Sunday Morning Star, Nov. 8, 1925 col. 3 he was born in Toronto and was a bass-baritone of the Metropolitan Opera Company. In WWI he served as captain.
